name: Chrubix
tagline: Your Chromebook is a Laptop Now
body:
# Welcome
Welcome to the Chrubix website. Chrubix is a project to make it easy for the owners of ARM-based Chromebooks to turn them into secure laptops.

## Support
Please go to the [wiki](https://github.com/ReubenAbrams/Chrubix/wiki) or [mailing list](http://ost.io/@ReubenAbrams/Chrubix) for support.

## Quick Start
If you don't own an ARM-based Chromebook, [buy](http://www.amazon.com/Samsung-XE303C12-A01US-Chromebook-Wi-Fi-11-6-Inch/dp/B009LL9VDG) [one](http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=34-131-403). If you already own one, do this:-
### Enter Developer Mode.
* Turn your laptop off. Hold the ESC and Refresh keys then press the Power key. The system will reboot and show the Recovery Mode screen.
* Press Control-D or wait 30 seconds. The system will boot and ask you to confirm that you wish to make the change.
* Say yes by pressing \<Enter\>.
* At the next power-on screen, press Control-D. Wait for 5-10 minutes while the laptop enters Developer Mode. 

### Log into ChromeOS. Install Chrubix.
* At the power-on screen, press Control-D. At the login window, configure your WiFi connection.
* At the sign-in window, press Control-Alt-F2 (the second key to the right of the ESC key).

### Type chromeos \<Enter\> to log in.
* Insert an SD card into the port on the left-hand side of the computer.
* At the hash ('#') prompt, type
_cd && wget bit.do/that && sudo bash that_ <Enter>

### Answer the on-screen questions.
* Choose the Linux distribution that you like the best. ('Alarmist' is an anagram of 'ARM [Tails](https://tails.boum.org)'...)
* Choose the type of installation: Temporary or Permanent.
* Specify your passwords (root, disk, etc.).
* Reboot
* Press Control-U.
* Enjoy!

![Chrubix Logo](https://static.squarespace.com/static/5358ad95e4b090d1c9b44af0/t/5358ae33e4b0e9fc04cf41a0/1398320710212/samsung-chromebook.jpg?format=500w)
